intro: Edwardsia hortensis, commonly known as the garden edwardsia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Ericaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of the Mediterranean and thrives in well-drained, acidic soils. The plant produces showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink, often blooming in late spring. It is typically shrub-like in habit, with evergreen foliage that remains dense throughout the growing season. Edwardsia hortensis is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to tolerate cooler climates.
